title: Sydney .NET User Group: Developing Intelligent Apps with Power BI Embedded

thumbnail.description: Sydney .NET User Group: Developing Intelligent Apps with Power BI Embedded

sessionTitle: Sydney .NET User Group: Developing Intelligent Apps with Power BI Embedded
eventShortDescription:
​Sydney .NET User Group: Developing Intelligent Apps with Power BI Embedded - Peter Myers

You may well be familiar with Microsoft’s cloud-based Business Intelligence service named Power BI. In this presentation, you will learn about a new Azure service which enables the embedding of Power BI reports into apps. Power BI Embedded effectively enables app developers to embed fully interactive reports into their apps, without requiring the time and expense of having to build controls from the ground up.
 
This presentation will introduce the service and describe its capabilities backed by theory and lots of demonstrations. Specific topics will describe how to develop Power BI reports, how to leverage custom visuals, how to effectively secure data, and how to embed reports with intelligent behaviours and actions by using the bidirectional JavaScript API.
 
This presentation is specifically targeted at app developers.

About the presenter:

Peter Myers is a consultant, trainer and presenter, and has worked with Microsoft database and development products since 1997. Today he specializes in all Microsoft Business Intelligence products and also authors training course content for Microsoft products and services. He has a broad business background supported by a bachelor’s degree in applied economics and accounting, and he extends this with extensive experience backed by current MCSE certifications. He has been a Data Platform MVP since 2007.

NOTE: Live stream not running :( 
Usually the Sydney .NET user group is livestreamed but this week our AV guys are on the Gold Coast filming for Ignite, so unfortunately this session will not be broadcast.
Don't worry though, we're still recording it, and we'll have the session up on SSW TV (https://tv.ssw.com/) ASAP.
